text:
According to the article, she was INDICTED by the Grand Jury, called a TRUE BILL. At the very least, she should have been given a copy of the Indictment, which was the basis for the #1 the arrest and #2 the Committal Order to the jail. So she was NOT arrested or held for NO REASON and once the case was dismissed in January 2013, she should have been immediately released.

This is NOT a case of two different justice systems or a case of poor Police work or even a case of lack of money. It was poor administrative work and poor representation by her Court Appointed Attorney.

The TRUE BILL Indictment from a Grand Jury STILL requires an arraignment and then the setting of a Court Date, possibly even a prelim, depending on state. The County Sheriff was acting WITHIN the scope of the law, as it was written at the time. The Court Appointed Lawyer FAILED to push the issue and file motions for arraignment or for bond.
Or, if these motions were filed, they were DENIED based on the law at the time.

The real problem is that 94% of America has NO IDEA on how a Grand Jury really works, who it is composed of, rules of evidence, witness questioning/statements and how the 5th and 6th Amendments fit into it because the proceedings of a Grand Jury are Secret.

To make it simple, the Grand jury system is primarily used to determine if there is Enough Evidence to bring a case to trial. Here in the Commonwealth of Virginia the Grand Jury system is used for ALL Felony cases. In some cases in conjunction with a prelim and some cases where reducing the Felony charge to a Misdemeanor.

White, a father-of-four from Mount Morris, was a passenger in a van when a six-pound rock thrown from an overpass smashed through the windshield, killing him, last week. Police say at least 20 rocks were found on the interstate, 80 miles north of Detroit. context_meta.summary: Oct. 24 (UPI) -- Celine Dion gave fans a rare glimpse of her twins on their birthday. The 49-year-old singer shared a picture with Eddy and Nelson, her younger sons with late husband Rene Angelil, from their Michael Jackson-themed birthday party Monday. "Can't believe you are already 7 years old... Time flies! Happy birthday, my loves!" she captioned the image. "I'm so proud of all of my boys! Mom xx... [photo by]: @denisetruscello." The snapshot shows Nelson and Eddy wearing black and white outfits inspired by Jackson, who died at age 50 in 2009. Several figurines of the late singer can be seen on a table in the background. Dion is also mom to 16-year-old Rene-Charles, her eldest son with Angelil.

context_meta.title: In Communist China, it's a man's world at the top
context_meta.summary: When Xi Jinping warned against "pleasure seeking" in a stern message to the Communist Party congress last week, the audience included few women and some notable absentees -- officials ousted by graft scandals involving illicit affairs. The scene was a reminder that China's leadership remains a man's world, where women have been excluded from the highest echelons of power and men have abused their positions in sex-for-favours scandals. Since the Communists took power in 1949, under Mao Zedong who famously declared that "women hold up half the sky", no woman has ever risen to the top ruling council.

context_meta.summary: Nearly two yeas later, Natalie Hosom, 36, and Brittany Park, 27, remain in a financial dispute with Columbus-based Habit for Humanity MidOhio  because the women are still on the hook for mortgages owed for their destroyed Parker Avenue homes. The two former homeowners and their children filed a lawsuit Monday in Franklin County Common Pleas Court, claiming Habitat for Humanity MidOhio refuses to honor a warranty that should pay for a replacement home because allegedly shoddy electrical work in a front porch light sparked a fire. Also named as defendants are Habitat for Humanity Michigan Fund, the loan servicer; State Farm Fire and Casualty, which insured Hosom's home; Peckin Insurance, which insured Park's home; and five "John Doe" individuals or entities who the plaintiffs claim are or may be liable in this case.
